comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content: The barquentine rigged John Williams was built in 1894 for the London Missionary Society, a Christian mission organisation. She served as a supply vessel between Australia and Pacific Islands to Australia's north and north-east including New Guinea. She was replaced and sold in 1931 for further service and was last heard of in Chinese waters in the 1950s.

comment.author: 51868163@N02
comment._content: John Williams was my ancestor. I've longed to retrace his missionary journeys through the South Pacific. Thank you for this picture.  (Stan Williams, Novi, MI, USA)
